app_metadata.description: 2FAuth is a web based self-hosted alternative to One Time Passcode (OTP) generators like Google Authenticator, designed for both mobile and desktop.
app_metadata.name: twofactor-auth
app_metadata.title: 2FAuth

attrs.label: App Key
attrs.description: The app key for 2FAuth.

attrs.label: App Name
attrs.description: The app name for 2FAuth.

attrs.label: App URL
attrs.description:
The app URL for 2FAuth.</br>
Setting this wrong will show a blank page.</br>
Examples:</br>
https://2fauth.example.com </br>
http://192.168.1.100:30081

attrs.label: Site Owner Email
attrs.description: The email address of the site owner.

attrs.label: Authentication Guard
attrs.description:
When using 'reverse-proxy-guard' 2FAuth only look for the dedicated headers and skip all
other built-in authentication checks. That means your proxy is fully responsible of the
authentication process, 2FAuth will trust him as long as headers are presents.

attrs.label: Authentication Proxy Header User
attrs.description:
Name of the HTTP headers sent by the reverse proxy that identifies the authenticated
user at proxy level. Check your proxy documentation to find out how these headers are named.

attrs.label: Authentication Proxy Header Email
attrs.description:
Name of the HTTP headers sent by the reverse proxy that identifies the authenticated
user at proxy level. Check your proxy documentation to find out how these headers are named.

attrs.label: WebAuthn User Verification
attrs.description:
Most authenticators and smartphones will ask the user to actively verify
themselves for log in. For example, through a touch plus pin code,
password entry, or biometric recognition (e.g., presenting a fingerprint).
The intent is to distinguish one user from any other.

attrs.label: Trusted Proxies
attrs.description: The list of proxies IP to trust

attrs.label: User ID
attrs.description: The user id that 2FAuth files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Group ID
attrs.description: The group id that 2FAuth files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Host Network
attrs.description: Bind to the host network. It's recommended to keep this disabled.

attrs.label: Port Bind Mode
attrs.description:
The port bind mode.</br>
- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

enum.description: Publish port on the host for external access

attrs.label: Host IPs
attrs.description: IPs on the host to bind this port

attrs.label: 2FAuth Config Storage
attrs.description: The path to store 2FAuth Config.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.label: ixVolume Configuration
attrs.description: The configuration for the ixVolume dataset.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the storage.

attrs.label: Dataset Name
attrs.description: The name of the dataset to use for storage.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the storage.

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: The host path to use for storage.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.</br>
SMB Share: Is a SMB share that is mounted to as a volume.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)
SMB/CIFS Share (Mounts a volume to a SMB share)

attrs.label: Read Only
attrs.description: Mount the volume as read only.

attrs.label: Mount Path
attrs.description: The path inside the container to mount the storage.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the storage.

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: The host path to use for storage.

attrs.label: ixVolume Configuration
attrs.description: The configuration for the ixVolume dataset.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the storage.

attrs.label: Dataset Name
attrs.description: The name of the dataset to use for storage.

attrs.label: SMB Configuration
attrs.description: The configuration for the SMB dataset.

attrs.label: Server
attrs.description: The server to mount the SMB share.

attrs.label: Path
attrs.description: The path to mount the SMB share.

attrs.label: Username
attrs.description: The username to use for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Password
attrs.description: The password to use for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Domain
attrs.description: The domain to use for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Containers
attrs.description: Containers where the label should be applied

attrs.label: CPUs
attrs.description: CPUs limit for 2FAuth.

attrs.label: Memory (in MB)
attrs.description: Memory limit for 2FAuth.

1.2.7.readme:
2FAuth

2FAuth is a web based self-hosted alternative to One Time Passcode (OTP) generators like Google Authenticator, designed for both mobile and desktop.

chart_metadata.description: 2FAuth is a web based self-hosted alternative to One Time Passcode (OTP) generators like Google Authenticator, designed for both mobile and desktop.
chart_metadata.name: twofactor-auth
chart_metadata.title: 2FAuth
